snippet: Born as James Howlett in 19th‑century Canada, Wolverine endured Weapon X experiments that bonded adamantium to his skeleton. His healing factor, heightened senses, and combat mastery make him the X‑Men’s fiercest defender.
Scott Summers unleashes concussive optic beams and leads the X‑Men with military precision. Ruby‑quartz visors let him control power that could otherwise shatter mountains.
Ororo Munroe commands atmospheric forces, summoning hurricanes or gentle rains at will. Worshipped as a goddess in Africa, she balances power with deep empathy and meditation.
An omega‑level mutant, Jean Grey wields formidable telepathy and telekinesis. Her bond with the Phoenix Force makes her a symbol of rebirth and cosmic power.

After a radioactive spider bite, Peter Parker gained wall‑crawling, spider‑sense, and super strength. Guided by the mantra ‘With great power comes great responsibility,’ he protects New York with wit and science.
Gamma radiation turned Bruce Banner into the Hulk, whose strength scales with anger. Feared as a walking cataclysm yet trusted by the Avengers in dire battles.
Steve Rogers, enhanced to peak human condition by the Super‑Soldier Serum, wields an indestructible vibranium shield and serves as the moral compass of the Avengers.
T’Challa, king of Wakanda, gains heightened abilities from the heart‑shaped herb and dons a vibranium‑woven suit, blending ancient tradition with futuristic tech.
Erik Lehnsherr manipulates magnetic fields on a planetary scale, driven by a resolve that mutants must never suffer oppression again.
Wanda Maximoff’s chaos magic can rewrite reality itself. Her struggle for control makes her both invaluable ally and existential threat.
